section1.title: You should know...
section1.text: That the GLORIA project is still at an early stage of development. We are a small and multidisciplinary team (astronomers, computer scientists, physicists, artists...) sharing a common vision to bring the sky into your home, school or lab.

section2.title: Our goal
section2.text: We want GLORIA to become the tool of choice for learning and research in astronomy. It is an ambitious goal and we know that there is a long road ahead. Our first milestone is to provide a set of experiments so you can test our telescopes and help researchers by doing image analysis.

section3.title: What can you do?
section3.paragraph1: The basic tool for learning and research is the experiment. In GLORIA we have two types of experiments: ones that take new images (`online') and ones that analyse images (`offline').
section3.paragraph2: Currently we offer four different experiments, which we want to improve with your help. Enjoy!

solar.title: Solar experiment
solar.desc: Explore the Sun and its spots. Take images to contribute to measurement of solar activity.

night.title: Night experiment
night.desc: Watch the night sky. Planets, stars, galaxies and asteroids await.

pspace.title: Personal space
pspace.desc: Choose an important event in your life and see the sky that was directly overhead at that exact moment.

wolf.title: Solar activity
wolf.desc: Analyse sunspots on your Android and contribute to the measurement of solar activity.

luiza.title: Variable stars
luiza.desc: View the light curve of a selected star.
